data.title: Household Hazardous Waste
data.meta_description: Find details about disposing of household hazardous waste in League City.
data.text:
Household Hazardous Waste Disposal Events

As part of League City’s agreement with AmeriWaste, there are two Household Hazardous Waste disposal events hosted at Hometown Heroes each year in the spring and fall. AmeriWaste will also provide four curbside HHW disposal events throughout the year.

Hometown Heroes HHW Disposal Events

2024 Household Hazardous Waste events at Hometown Heroes Park will be held on March 16 and September 14. Learn more about the Household Hazardous Waste events here.

Curbside HHW Pickup Events

Curbside pickup events are for televisions, electronics, microwaves, and appliances only. Other hazardous waste material will need to be disposed of during the spring or fall disposal events at Hometown Heroes. You MUST CALL to get on the pickup list. See below for scheduling and pickup dates for 2024.

Pickup Dates May 13–18, 2024

Residential customers *only* must call AmeriWaste at 281-585-3200 between April 15 and April 30 to be added to the pickup list. Curbside pickups will be from May 13–18. AmeriWaste will notify residents by phone of their pickup date.

Pickup Dates July 8–13, 2024

Residential customers *only* must call AmeriWaste at 281-585-3200 between June 10 and June 30 to be added to the pickup list. Curbside pickups will be from July 8–13. AmeriWaste will notify residents by phone of their pickup date.

Pickup Dates November 11–16, 2024

Residential customers *only* must call AmeriWaste at 281-585-3200 between October 14 and October 31 to be added to the pickup list. Curbside pickups will be from November 11–16. AmeriWaste will notify residents by phone of their pickup date.

Household Hazardous Waste Disposal at Stella Roberts Facility

Stella Roberts Recycling Center in Pearland takes a variety of Hazardous Waste Materials. Residents can make an appointment to drop off HHW at the facility—located at 5800 Magnolia Pkwy—from Tuesday through Saturday. Beginning May 1, 2024, League City residents will be required to pay $1.50 per pound for items like paint and household chemicals and $5.00 – $15.00 per television.

Acceptable items include brake fluid, household chemicals and cleaners, paints and stains (max of 25 cans), general chemicals and adhesives, and lawn and pool chemicals. If your material is not listed, please call ahead at 281-489-2795 prior to booking your appointment.

Schedule an appointment

Freon Disposal

Customers looking to dispose of refrigerators, air conditioners, or other cooling devices are responsible for properly dealing with Freon disposal before the items are picked up. The item must be drained of Freon by a licensed HVAC technician or plumber. A tag bearing the service provider’s license number and date of service must been affixed to the appliance ensuring all refrigerant has been removed and properly disposed of according to state law.
